ospfv3MIB.name: ospfv3MIB
ospfv3MIB.contactinfo: WG E-Mail: ospf@ietf.org WG Chairs: Acee Lindem acee@redback.com Abhay Roy akr@cisco.com Editors: Dan Joyal Nortel 600 Technology Park Drive Billerica, MA 01821, USA djoyal@nortel.com Vishwas Manral IP Infusion Almora, Uttarakhand India vishwas@ipinfusion.com

Ospfv3UpToRefreshIntervalTC.name: Ospfv3UpToRefreshIntervalTC
Ospfv3UpToRefreshIntervalTC.description: The values one might be able to configure for variables bounded by the Refresh Interval.
Ospfv3UpToRefreshIntervalTC.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix B, Architectural Constants

Ospfv3DeadIntervalRangeTC.name: Ospfv3DeadIntervalRangeTC
Ospfv3DeadIntervalRangeTC.description: The range, in seconds, of dead interval value.
Ospfv3DeadIntervalRangeTC.reference: OSPF for IPv6, Appendix C.3, Router Interface Parameters

Ospfv3RouterIdTC.name: Ospfv3RouterIdTC
Ospfv3RouterIdTC.description: A 32-bit, unsigned integer uniquely identifying the router in the Autonomous System. To ensure uniqueness, this may default to the value of one of the router's IPv4 host addresses if IPv4 is configured on the router.
Ospfv3RouterIdTC.reference: OSPF for IPv6, Appendix C.1, Global Parameters

Ospfv3LsIdTC.name: Ospfv3LsIdTC
Ospfv3LsIdTC.description: A unique 32-bit identifier of the piece of the routing domain that is being described by a link state advertisement. In contrast to OSPFv2, the Link State ID (LSID) has no addressing semantics.
Ospfv3LsIdTC.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 12.1.4, Link State ID

Ospfv3AreaIdTC.name: Ospfv3AreaIdTC
Ospfv3AreaIdTC.description: An OSPFv3 Area Identifier. A value of zero identifies the backbone area.
Ospfv3AreaIdTC.reference: OSPF for IPv6, Appendix C.3 Router Interface Parameters

Ospfv3IfInstIdTC.name: Ospfv3IfInstIdTC
Ospfv3IfInstIdTC.reference: OSPF for IPv6, Appendix C.3, Router Interface Parameters

Ospfv3LsaSequenceTC.name: Ospfv3LsaSequenceTC
Ospfv3LsaSequenceTC.description: The sequence number field is a signed 32-bit integer. It is used to detect old and duplicate link state advertisements. The space of sequence numbers is linearly ordered. The larger the sequence number, the more recent the advertisement.
Ospfv3LsaSequenceTC.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 12.1.6, LS sequence number

Ospfv3LsaAgeTC.name: Ospfv3LsaAgeTC
Ospfv3LsaAgeTC.description: The age of the link state advertisement in seconds. The high-order bit of the LS age field is considered the DoNotAge bit for support of on-demand circuits.
Ospfv3LsaAgeTC.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 12.1.1, LS age; Extending OSPF to Support Demand Circuits, Section 2.2, The LS age field

ospfv3RouterId.name: ospfv3RouterId
ospfv3RouterId.reference: OSPF for IPv6, Appendix C.1, Global Parameters
ospfv3RouterId.description: A 32-bit unsigned integer uniquely identifying the router in the Autonomous System. To ensure uniqueness, this may default to the 32-bit unsigned integer representation of one of the router's IPv4 interface addresses (if IPv4 is configured on the router). This object is persistent, and when written, the entity SHOULD save the change to non-volatile storage.

ospfv3AdminStatus.name: ospfv3AdminStatus
ospfv3AdminStatus.description: The administrative status of OSPFv3 in the router. The value 'enabled' denotes that the OSPFv3 Process is active on at least one interface; 'disabled' disables it on all interfaces. This object is persistent, and when written, the entity SHOULD save the change to non-volatile storage.

ospfv3VersionNumber.name: ospfv3VersionNumber
ospfv3VersionNumber.description: The version number of OSPF for IPv6 is 3.

ospfv3AreaBdrRtrStatus.name: ospfv3AreaBdrRtrStatus
ospfv3AreaBdrRtrStatus.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 3, Splitting the AS into Areas
ospfv3AreaBdrRtrStatus.description: A flag to denote whether this router is an area border router. The value of this object is true (1) when the router is an area border router.

ospfv3ASBdrRtrStatus.name: ospfv3ASBdrRtrStatus
ospfv3ASBdrRtrStatus.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 3.3, Classification of routers
ospfv3ASBdrRtrStatus.description: A flag to note whether this router is configured as an Autonomous System border router. This object is persistent, and when written, the entity SHOULD save the change to non-volatile storage.

ospfv3AsScopeLsaCount.name: ospfv3AsScopeLsaCount
ospfv3AsScopeLsaCount.description: The number of AS-scope (e.g., AS-External) link state advertisements in the link state database.

ospfv3AsScopeLsaCksumSum.name: ospfv3AsScopeLsaCksumSum
ospfv3AsScopeLsaCksumSum.description: The 32-bit unsigned sum of the LS checksums of the AS-scoped link state advertisements contained in the link state database. This sum can be used to determine if there has been a change in a router's link state database or to compare the link state database of two routers.

ospfv3OriginateNewLsas.name: ospfv3OriginateNewLsas
ospfv3OriginateNewLsas.description: The number of new link state advertisements that have been originated. This number is incremented each time the router originates a new LSA. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system and at other times as indicated by the value of ospfv3DiscontinuityTime.

ospfv3RxNewLsas.name: ospfv3RxNewLsas
ospfv3RxNewLsas.description: The number of link state advertisements received that are determined to be new instantiations. This number does not include newer instantiations of self-originated link state advertisements. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system and at other times as indicated by the value of ospfv3DiscontinuityTime.

ospfv3ExtLsaCount.name: ospfv3ExtLsaCount
ospfv3ExtLsaCount.description: The number of External (LS type 0x4005) in the link state database.

ospfv3ExtAreaLsdbLimit.name: ospfv3ExtAreaLsdbLimit
ospfv3ExtAreaLsdbLimit.description: The maximum number of non-default AS-external-LSA entries that can be stored in the link state database. If the value is -1, then there is no limit. When the number of non-default AS-external-LSAs in a router's link state database reaches ospfv3ExtAreaLsdbLimit, the router enters Overflow state. The router never holds more than ospfv3ExtAreaLsdbLimit non-default AS-external-LSAs in its database. ospfv3ExtAreaLsdbLimit MUST be set identically in all routers attached to the OSPFv3 backbone and/or any regular OSPFv3 area (i.e., OSPFv3 stub areas and not-so-stubby-areas (NSSAs) are excluded). This object is persistent, and when written, the entity SHOULD save the change to non-volatile storage.

ospfv3ExitOverflowInterval.name: ospfv3ExitOverflowInterval
ospfv3ExitOverflowInterval.description: The number of seconds that, after entering Overflow state, a router will attempt to leave Overflow state. This allows the router to again originate non-default, AS-External-LSAs. When set to 0, the router will not leave Overflow state until restarted. This object is persistent, and when written, the entity SHOULD save the change to non-volatile storage.

ospfv3DemandExtensions.name: ospfv3DemandExtensions
ospfv3DemandExtensions.reference: OSPF Version 2; Extending OSPF to Support Demand Circuits
ospfv3DemandExtensions.description: The router's support for demand circuits. The value of this object is true (1) when demand circuits are supported. This object is persistent, and when written, the entity SHOULD save the change to non-volatile storage.

ospfv3ReferenceBandwidth.name: ospfv3ReferenceBandwidth
ospfv3ReferenceBandwidth.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.3, Router interface parameters
ospfv3ReferenceBandwidth.description: Reference bandwidth in kilobits per second for calculating default interface metrics. The default value is 100,000 KBPS (100 MBPS). This object is persistent, and when written, the entity SHOULD save the change to non-volatile storage.

ospfv3RestartSupport.name: ospfv3RestartSupport
ospfv3RestartSupport.reference: Graceful OSPF Restart, Appendix B.1, Global Parameters (Minimum subset)
ospfv3RestartSupport.description: The router's support for OSPF graceful restart. Options include no restart support, only planned restarts, or both planned and unplanned restarts. This object is persistent, and when written, the entity SHOULD save the change to non-volatile storage.

ospfv3RestartInterval.name: ospfv3RestartInterval
ospfv3RestartInterval.reference: Graceful OSPF Restart, Appendix B.1, Global Parameters (Minimum subset)
ospfv3RestartInterval.description: Configured OSPF graceful restart timeout interval. This object is persistent, and when written, the entity SHOULD save the change to non-volatile storage.

ospfv3RestartStrictLsaChecking.name: ospfv3RestartStrictLsaChecking
ospfv3RestartStrictLsaChecking.reference: Graceful OSPF Restart, Appendix B.2, Global Parameters (Optional)
ospfv3RestartStrictLsaChecking.description: Indicates if strict LSA checking is enabled for graceful restart. A value of true (1) indicates that strict LSA checking is enabled. This object is persistent, and when written, the entity SHOULD save the change to non-volatile storage.

ospfv3RestartStatus.name: ospfv3RestartStatus
ospfv3RestartStatus.description: The current status of OSPF graceful restart capability.

ospfv3RestartAge.name: ospfv3RestartAge
ospfv3RestartAge.description: Remaining time in the current OSPF graceful restart interval.

ospfv3RestartExitReason.name: ospfv3RestartExitReason
ospfv3RestartExitReason.description: Describes the outcome of the last attempt at a graceful restart. none: no restart has yet been attempted. inProgress: a restart attempt is currently underway. completed: the last restart completed successfully. timedOut: the last restart timed out. topologyChanged: the last restart was aborted due to a topology change.

ospfv3NotificationEnable.name: ospfv3NotificationEnable
ospfv3NotificationEnable.description: This object provides a coarse level of control over the generation of OSPFv3 notifications. If this object is set to true (1), then it enables the generation of OSPFv3 notifications. If it is set to false (2), these notifications are not generated. This object is persistent, and when written, the entity SHOULD save the change to non-volatile storage.

ospfv3StubRouterSupport.name: ospfv3StubRouterSupport
ospfv3StubRouterSupport.description: The router's support for stub router functionality. An object value of true (1) indicates that stub router functionality is supported.

ospfv3StubRouterAdvertisement.name: ospfv3StubRouterAdvertisement
ospfv3StubRouterAdvertisement.reference: OSPF Stub Router Advertisement, Section 2, Proposed Solution
ospfv3StubRouterAdvertisement.description: This object controls the advertisement of stub LSAs by the router. The value doNotAdvertise (1) will result in the advertisement of standard LSAs and is the default value. This object is persistent, and when written, the entity SHOULD save the change to non-volatile storage.

ospfv3DiscontinuityTime.name: ospfv3DiscontinuityTime
ospfv3DiscontinuityTime.description: The value of sysUpTime on the most recent occasion at which any one of this MIB's counters suffered a discontinuity. If no such discontinuities have occurred since the last re-initialization of the local management subsystem, then this object contains a zero value.

ospfv3RestartTime.name: ospfv3RestartTime
ospfv3RestartTime.description: The value of sysUpTime on the most recent occasion at which the ospfv3RestartExitReason was updated.

ospfv3AreaTable.name: ospfv3AreaTable
ospfv3AreaTable.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 6, The Area Data Structure
ospfv3AreaTable.description: Information describing the configured parameters and cumulative statistics of the router's attached areas. The interfaces and virtual links are configured as part of these areas. Area 0, by definition, is the backbone area.

ospfv3AreaEntry.name: ospfv3AreaEntry
ospfv3AreaEntry.description: Information describing the configured parameters and cumulative statistics of one of the router's attached areas. The information in this table is persistent, and when written, the entity SHOULD save the a change to non-volatile storage.

ospfv3AreaId.name: ospfv3AreaId
ospfv3AreaId.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.2, Area parameters
ospfv3AreaId.description: A 32-bit unsigned integer uniquely identifying an area. Area ID 0 is used for the OSPFv3 backbone.

ospfv3AreaImportAsExtern.name: ospfv3AreaImportAsExtern
ospfv3AreaImportAsExtern.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.2, Area parameters
ospfv3AreaImportAsExtern.description: Indicates whether an area is a stub area, NSSA, or standard area. AS-scope LSAs are not imported into stub areas or NSSAs. NSSAs import AS-External data as NSSA LSAs that have Area-scope.

ospfv3AreaSpfRuns.name: ospfv3AreaSpfRuns
ospfv3AreaSpfRuns.description: The number of times that the intra-area route table has been calculated using this area's link state database. This is typically done using Dijkstra's algorithm. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system and at other times as indicated by the value of ospfv3DiscontinuityTime.

ospfv3AreaBdrRtrCount.name: ospfv3AreaBdrRtrCount
ospfv3AreaBdrRtrCount.description: The total number of area border routers reachable within this area. This is initially zero, and is calculated in each Shortest Path First (SPF) pass.

ospfv3AreaAsBdrRtrCount.name: ospfv3AreaAsBdrRtrCount
ospfv3AreaAsBdrRtrCount.description: The total number of Autonomous System border routers reachable within this area. This is initially zero, and is calculated in each SPF pass.

ospfv3AreaScopeLsaCount.name: ospfv3AreaScopeLsaCount
ospfv3AreaScopeLsaCount.description: The total number of Area-scope link state advertisements in this area's link state database.

ospfv3AreaScopeLsaCksumSum.name: ospfv3AreaScopeLsaCksumSum
ospfv3AreaScopeLsaCksumSum.description: The 32-bit unsigned sum of the Area-scope link state advertisements' LS checksums contained in this area's link state database. The sum can be used to determine if there has been a change in a router's link state database or to compare the link state database of two routers.

ospfv3AreaSummary.name: ospfv3AreaSummary
ospfv3AreaSummary.description: The variable ospfv3AreaSummary controls the import of Inter-Area LSAs into stub and NSSA areas. It has no effect on other areas. If it is noAreaSummary, the router will neither originate nor propagate Inter-Area LSAs into the stub or NSSA area. It will only advertise a default route. If it is sendAreaSummary, the router will both summarize and propagate Inter-Area LSAs.

ospfv3AreaRowStatus.name: ospfv3AreaRowStatus
ospfv3AreaRowStatus.description: This object permits management of the table by facilitating actions such as row creation, construction, and destruction. The value of this object has no effect on whether other objects in this conceptual row can be modified.

ospfv3AreaStubMetric.name: ospfv3AreaStubMetric
ospfv3AreaStubMetric.description: The metric value advertised for the default route into stub and NSSA areas. By default, this equals the least metric among the interfaces to other areas.

ospfv3AreaNssaTranslatorRole.name: ospfv3AreaNssaTranslatorRole
ospfv3AreaNssaTranslatorRole.description: Indicates an NSSA border router's policy to perform NSSA translation of NSSA-LSAs into AS-External-LSAs.

ospfv3AreaNssaTranslatorState.name: ospfv3AreaNssaTranslatorState
ospfv3AreaNssaTranslatorState.description: Indicates if and how an NSSA border router is performing NSSA translation of NSSA-LSAs into AS-External-LSAs. When this object is set to 'enabled', the NSSA border router's ospfv3AreaNssaTranslatorRole has been set to 'always'. When this object is set to 'elected', a candidate NSSA border router is translating NSSA-LSAs into AS-External-LSAs. When this object is set to 'disabled', a candidate NSSA Border router is NOT translating NSSA-LSAs into AS-External-LSAs.

ospfv3AreaNssaTranslatorStabInterval.name: ospfv3AreaNssaTranslatorStabInterval
ospfv3AreaNssaTranslatorStabInterval.description: The stability interval defined as the number of seconds after an elected translator determines its services are no longer required that it should continue to perform its translation duties.

ospfv3AreaNssaTranslatorEvents.name: ospfv3AreaNssaTranslatorEvents
ospfv3AreaNssaTranslatorEvents.description: Indicates the number of Translator state changes that have occurred since the last start-up of the OSPFv3 routing process. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system and at other times as indicated by the value of ospfv3DiscontinuityTime.

ospfv3AreaStubMetricType.name: ospfv3AreaStubMetricType
ospfv3AreaStubMetricType.description: This variable assigns the type of metric advertised as a default route.

ospfv3AreaTEEnabled.name: ospfv3AreaTEEnabled
ospfv3AreaTEEnabled.description: Indicates whether or not traffic engineering is enabled in the area. The object is set to the value true (1) to enable traffic engineering. Traffic engineering is disabled by default.

ospfv3AsLsdbTable.name: ospfv3AsLsdbTable
ospfv3AsLsdbTable.description: The OSPFv3 Process's AS-scope link state database (LSDB). The LSDB contains the AS-scope link state advertisements from throughout the areas that the device is attached to.

ospfv3AsLsdbEntry.name: ospfv3AsLsdbEntry
ospfv3AsLsdbEntry.description: A single AS-scope link state advertisement.

ospfv3AsLsdbType.name: ospfv3AsLsdbType
ospfv3AsLsdbType.description: The type of the link state advertisement. Each link state type has a separate advertisement format. AS-scope LSAs not recognized by the router may be stored in the database.

ospfv3AsLsdbRouterId.name: ospfv3AsLsdbRouterId
ospfv3AsLsdbRouterId.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.1, Global parameters
ospfv3AsLsdbRouterId.description: The 32-bit number that uniquely identifies the originating router in the Autonomous System.

ospfv3AsLsdbLsid.name: ospfv3AsLsdbLsid
ospfv3AsLsdbLsid.description: The Link State ID is an LS type-specific field containing a unique identifier; it identifies the piece of the routing domain that is being described by the advertisement. In contrast to OSPFv2, the LSID has no addressing semantics.

ospfv3AsLsdbSequence.name: ospfv3AsLsdbSequence
ospfv3AsLsdbSequence.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 12.1.6, LS sequence number
ospfv3AsLsdbSequence.description: The sequence number field is a signed 32-bit integer. It is used to detect old and duplicate link state advertisements. The space of sequence numbers is linearly ordered. The larger the sequence number, the more recent the advertisement.

ospfv3AsLsdbAge.name: ospfv3AsLsdbAge
ospfv3AsLsdbAge.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 12.1.1, LS age; Extending OSPF to Support Demand Circuits, Section 2.2, The LS age field.
ospfv3AsLsdbAge.description: This field is the age of the link state advertisement in seconds. The high-order bit of the LS age field is considered the DoNotAge bit for support of on-demand circuits.

ospfv3AsLsdbChecksum.name: ospfv3AsLsdbChecksum
ospfv3AsLsdbChecksum.description: This field is the checksum of the complete contents of the advertisement, excepting the age field. The age field is excepted so that an advertisement's age can be incremented without updating the checksum. The checksum used is the same that is used for ISO connectionless datagrams; it is commonly referred to as the Fletcher checksum.

ospfv3AsLsdbAdvertisement.name: ospfv3AsLsdbAdvertisement
ospfv3AsLsdbAdvertisement.description: The entire link state advertisement, including its header.

ospfv3AsLsdbTypeKnown.name: ospfv3AsLsdbTypeKnown
ospfv3AsLsdbTypeKnown.description: The value true (1) indicates that the LSA type is recognized by this router.

ospfv3AreaLsdbTable.name: ospfv3AreaLsdbTable
ospfv3AreaLsdbTable.description: The OSPFv3 Process's Area-scope LSDB. The LSDB contains the Area-scope link state advertisements from throughout the area that the device is attached to.

ospfv3AreaLsdbEntry.name: ospfv3AreaLsdbEntry
ospfv3AreaLsdbEntry.description: A single Area-scope link state advertisement.

ospfv3AreaLsdbAreaId.name: ospfv3AreaLsdbAreaId
ospfv3AreaLsdbAreaId.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.2, Area parameters
ospfv3AreaLsdbAreaId.description: The 32-bit identifier of the Area from which the LSA was received.

ospfv3AreaLsdbType.name: ospfv3AreaLsdbType
ospfv3AreaLsdbType.description: The type of the link state advertisement. Each link state type has a separate advertisement format. Area-scope LSAs unrecognized by the router are also stored in this database.

ospfv3AreaLsdbRouterId.name: ospfv3AreaLsdbRouterId
ospfv3AreaLsdbRouterId.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.1, Global parameters
ospfv3AreaLsdbRouterId.description: The 32-bit number that uniquely identifies the originating router in the Autonomous System.

ospfv3AreaLsdbLsid.name: ospfv3AreaLsdbLsid
ospfv3AreaLsdbLsid.description: The Link State ID is an LS type-specific field containing a unique identifier; it identifies the piece of the routing domain that is being described by the advertisement. In contrast to OSPFv2, the LSID has no addressing semantics.

ospfv3AreaLsdbSequence.name: ospfv3AreaLsdbSequence
ospfv3AreaLsdbSequence.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 12.1.6, LS sequence number
ospfv3AreaLsdbSequence.description: The sequence number field is a signed 32-bit integer. It is used to detect old and duplicate link state advertisements. The space of sequence numbers is linearly ordered. The larger the sequence number, the more recent the advertisement.

ospfv3AreaLsdbAge.name: ospfv3AreaLsdbAge
ospfv3AreaLsdbAge.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 12.1.1, LS age; Extending OSPF to Support Demand Circuits, Section 2.2, The LS age field.
ospfv3AreaLsdbAge.description: This field is the age of the link state advertisement in seconds. The high-order bit of the LS age field is considered the DoNotAge bit for support of on-demand circuits.

ospfv3AreaLsdbChecksum.name: ospfv3AreaLsdbChecksum
ospfv3AreaLsdbChecksum.description: This field is the checksum of the complete contents of the advertisement, excepting the age field. The age field is excepted so that an advertisement's age can be incremented without updating the checksum. The checksum used is the same that is used for ISO connectionless datagrams; it is commonly referred to as the Fletcher checksum.

ospfv3AreaLsdbAdvertisement.name: ospfv3AreaLsdbAdvertisement
ospfv3AreaLsdbAdvertisement.description: The entire link state advertisement, including its header.

ospfv3AreaLsdbTypeKnown.name: ospfv3AreaLsdbTypeKnown
ospfv3AreaLsdbTypeKnown.description: The value true (1) indicates that the LSA type is recognized by this router.

ospfv3LinkLsdbTable.name: ospfv3LinkLsdbTable
ospfv3LinkLsdbTable.description: The OSPFv3 Process's Link-scope LSDB for non-virtual interfaces. The LSDB contains the Link-scope link state advertisements from the interfaces that the device is attached to.

ospfv3LinkLsdbEntry.name: ospfv3LinkLsdbEntry
ospfv3LinkLsdbEntry.description: A single Link-scope link state advertisement.

ospfv3LinkLsdbIfIndex.name: ospfv3LinkLsdbIfIndex
ospfv3LinkLsdbIfIndex.description: The identifier of the link from which the LSA was received.

ospfv3LinkLsdbIfInstId.name: ospfv3LinkLsdbIfInstId
ospfv3LinkLsdbIfInstId.description: The identifier of the interface instance from which the LSA was received.

ospfv3LinkLsdbType.name: ospfv3LinkLsdbType
ospfv3LinkLsdbType.description: The type of the link state advertisement. Each link state type has a separate advertisement format. Link-scope LSAs unrecognized by the router are also stored in this database.

ospfv3LinkLsdbRouterId.name: ospfv3LinkLsdbRouterId
ospfv3LinkLsdbRouterId.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.1, Global parameters
ospfv3LinkLsdbRouterId.description: The 32-bit number that uniquely identifies the originating router in the Autonomous System.

ospfv3LinkLsdbLsid.name: ospfv3LinkLsdbLsid
ospfv3LinkLsdbLsid.description: The Link State ID is an LS type-specific field containing a unique identifier; it identifies the piece of the routing domain that is being described by the advertisement. In contrast to OSPFv2, the LSID has no addressing semantics. However, in OSPFv3 the Link State ID always contains the flooding scope of the LSA.

ospfv3LinkLsdbSequence.name: ospfv3LinkLsdbSequence
ospfv3LinkLsdbSequence.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 12.1.6, LS sequence number
ospfv3LinkLsdbSequence.description: The sequence number field is a signed 32-bit integer. It is used to detect old and duplicate link state advertisements. The space of sequence numbers is linearly ordered. The larger the sequence number, the more recent the advertisement.

ospfv3LinkLsdbAge.name: ospfv3LinkLsdbAge
ospfv3LinkLsdbAge.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 12.1.1, LS age; Extending OSPF to Support Demand Circuits, Section 2.2, The LS age field.
ospfv3LinkLsdbAge.description: This field is the age of the link state advertisement in seconds. The high-order bit of the LS age field is considered the DoNotAge bit for support of on-demand circuits.

ospfv3LinkLsdbChecksum.name: ospfv3LinkLsdbChecksum
ospfv3LinkLsdbChecksum.description: This field is the checksum of the complete contents of the advertisement, excepting the age field. The age field is excepted so that an advertisement's age can be incremented without updating the checksum. The checksum used is the same that is used for ISO connectionless datagrams; it is commonly referred to as the Fletcher checksum.

ospfv3LinkLsdbAdvertisement.name: ospfv3LinkLsdbAdvertisement
ospfv3LinkLsdbAdvertisement.description: The entire link state advertisement, including its header.

ospfv3LinkLsdbTypeKnown.name: ospfv3LinkLsdbTypeKnown
ospfv3LinkLsdbTypeKnown.description: The value true (1) indicates that the LSA type is recognized by this router.

ospfv3HostTable.name: ospfv3HostTable
ospfv3HostTable.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.7, Host route parameters
ospfv3HostTable.description: The Host/Metric Table indicates what hosts are directly attached to the router and their corresponding metrics.

ospfv3HostEntry.name: ospfv3HostEntry
ospfv3HostEntry.description: A metric to be advertised when a given host is reachable. The information in this table is persistent, and when written, the entity SHOULD save the change to non-volatile storage.

ospfv3HostAddressType.name: ospfv3HostAddressType
ospfv3HostAddressType.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.7, Host route parameters
ospfv3HostAddressType.description: The address type of ospfv3HostAddress. Only IPv6 global address type is expected.

ospfv3HostAddress.name: ospfv3HostAddress
ospfv3HostAddress.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.7, Host route parameters
ospfv3HostAddress.description: The IPv6 address of the host. Must be an IPv6 global address.

ospfv3HostMetric.name: ospfv3HostMetric
ospfv3HostMetric.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.7, Host route parameters

ospfv3HostRowStatus.name: ospfv3HostRowStatus
ospfv3HostRowStatus.description: This object permits management of the table by facilitating actions such as row creation, construction, and destruction. The value of this object has no effect on whether other objects in this conceptual row can be modified.

ospfv3HostAreaID.name: ospfv3HostAreaID
ospfv3HostAreaID.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.2, Area parameters
ospfv3HostAreaID.description: The Area the host entry is to be found within. By default, the area for the subsuming OSPFv3 interface, or Area 0 if there is no subsuming interface.

ospfv3IfTable.name: ospfv3IfTable
ospfv3IfTable.reference: OSPF for IPv6, Appendix C.3, Router Interface Parameters
ospfv3IfTable.description: The OSPFv3 Interface Table describes the interfaces from the viewpoint of OSPFv3.

ospfv3IfEntry.name: ospfv3IfEntry
ospfv3IfEntry.description: The OSPFv3 Interface Entry describes one interface from the viewpoint of OSPFv3. The information in this table is persistent, and when written, the entity SHOULD save the change to non-volatile storage.

ospfv3IfIndex.name: ospfv3IfIndex
ospfv3IfIndex.description: The interface index of this OSPFv3 interface. It corresponds to the interface index of the IPv6 interface on which OSPFv3 is configured.

ospfv3IfInstId.name: ospfv3IfInstId
ospfv3IfInstId.description: Enables multiple interface instances of OSPFv3 to be run over a single link. Each interface instance would be assigned a separate ID. This ID has local link significance only.

ospfv3IfAreaId.name: ospfv3IfAreaId
ospfv3IfAreaId.description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the area to which the interface connects. Area ID 0 is used for the OSPFv3 backbone.

ospfv3IfAdminStatus.name: ospfv3IfAdminStatus
ospfv3IfAdminStatus.description: The OSPFv3 interface's administrative status. The value formed on the interface; the interface will be advertised as an internal route to some area. The value 'disabled' denotes that the interface is external to OSPFv3. Note that a value of 'disabled' for the object ospfv3AdminStatus will override a value of 'enabled' for the interface.

ospfv3IfRtrPriority.name: ospfv3IfRtrPriority
ospfv3IfRtrPriority.description: The priority of this interface. Used in multi-access networks, this field is used in the designated-router election algorithm. The value 0 signifies that the router is not eligible to become the Designated Router on this particular network. In the event of a tie in this value, routers will use their Router ID as a tie breaker.

ospfv3IfTransitDelay.name: ospfv3IfTransitDelay
ospfv3IfTransitDelay.reference: OSPF for IPv6, Appendix C.3, Router Interface Parameters.
ospfv3IfTransitDelay.description: The estimated number of seconds it takes to transmit a Link State Update packet over this interface. LSAs contained in the update packet must have their age incremented by this amount before transmission. This value should take into account the transmission and propagation delays of the interface.

ospfv3IfRetransInterval.name: ospfv3IfRetransInterval
ospfv3IfRetransInterval.description: The number of seconds between link state advertisement retransmissions for adjacencies belonging to this interface. This value is also used when retransmitting database description and Link State Request packets.

ospfv3IfHelloInterval.name: ospfv3IfHelloInterval
ospfv3IfHelloInterval.description: The length of time, in seconds, between the Hello packets that the router sends on the interface. This value must be the same for all routers attached to a common network.

ospfv3IfRtrDeadInterval.name: ospfv3IfRtrDeadInterval
ospfv3IfRtrDeadInterval.description: The number of seconds that a router's Hello packets have not been seen before its neighbors declare the router down on the interface. This should be some multiple of the Hello interval. This value must be the same for all routers attached to a common network.

ospfv3IfPollInterval.name: ospfv3IfPollInterval
ospfv3IfPollInterval.description: The larger time interval, in seconds, between the Hello packets sent to an inactive, non-broadcast multi-access neighbor.

ospfv3IfState.name: ospfv3IfState
ospfv3IfState.description: The OSPFv3 interface state. An interface may be in standby state if there are multiple interfaces on the link and another interface is active. The interface may be in Down state if the underlying IPv6 interface is down or if the admin status is 'disabled' either globally or for the interface.

ospfv3IfDesignatedRouter.name: ospfv3IfDesignatedRouter
ospfv3IfDesignatedRouter.description: The Router ID of the Designated Router.

ospfv3IfBackupDesignatedRouter.name: ospfv3IfBackupDesignatedRouter
ospfv3IfBackupDesignatedRouter.description: The Router ID of the Backup Designated Router.

ospfv3IfEvents.name: ospfv3IfEvents
ospfv3IfEvents.description: The number of times this OSPFv3 interface has changed its state or an error has occurred. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system and at other times as indicated by the value of ospfv3DiscontinuityTime.

ospfv3IfRowStatus.name: ospfv3IfRowStatus
ospfv3IfRowStatus.description: This object permits management of the table by facilitating actions such as row creation, construction, and destruction. The value of this object has no effect on whether other objects in this conceptual row can be modified.

ospfv3IfDemand.name: ospfv3IfDemand
ospfv3IfDemand.description: Indicates whether Demand OSPFv3 procedures (Hello suppression to FULL neighbors and setting the DoNotAge flag on propagated LSAs) should be performed on this interface.

ospfv3IfMetricValue.name: ospfv3IfMetricValue
ospfv3IfMetricValue.description: The metric assigned to this interface. The default value of the metric is 'Reference Bandwidth / ifSpeed'. The value of the reference bandwidth can be set in the ospfv3ReferenceBandwidth object.

ospfv3IfLinkScopeLsaCount.name: ospfv3IfLinkScopeLsaCount
ospfv3IfLinkScopeLsaCount.description: The total number of Link-scope link state advertisements in this link's link state database.

ospfv3IfLinkLsaCksumSum.name: ospfv3IfLinkLsaCksumSum
ospfv3IfLinkLsaCksumSum.description: The 32-bit unsigned sum of the Link-scope link state advertisements' LS checksums contained in this link's link state database. The sum can be used to determine if there has been a change in a router's link state database or to compare the link state database of two routers.

ospfv3IfDemandNbrProbe.name: ospfv3IfDemandNbrProbe
ospfv3IfDemandNbrProbe.description: Indicates whether or not neighbor probing is enabled to determine whether or not the neighbor is inactive. Neighbor probing is disabled by default.

ospfv3IfDemandNbrProbeRetransLimit.name: ospfv3IfDemandNbrProbeRetransLimit
ospfv3IfDemandNbrProbeRetransLimit.description: The number of consecutive LSA retransmissions before the neighbor is deemed inactive and the neighbor adjacency is brought down.

ospfv3IfDemandNbrProbeInterval.name: ospfv3IfDemandNbrProbeInterval
ospfv3IfDemandNbrProbeInterval.description: Defines how often the neighbor will be probed.

ospfv3IfTEDisabled.name: ospfv3IfTEDisabled
ospfv3IfTEDisabled.description: Indicates whether or not traffic engineering is disabled on the interface when traffic engineering is enabled in the area where the interface is attached. The object is set to the value true (1) to disable traffic engineering on the interface. Traffic engineering is enabled by default on the interface when traffic engineering is enabled in the area where the interface is attached.

ospfv3IfLinkLSASuppression.name: ospfv3IfLinkLSASuppression
ospfv3IfLinkLSASuppression.reference: OSPF for IPv6, Appendix C.3, Router Interface Parameters
ospfv3IfLinkLSASuppression.description: Specifies whether or not link LSA origination is suppressed for broadcast or NBMA interface types. The object is set to value true (1) to suppress the origination.

ospfv3VirtIfTable.name: ospfv3VirtIfTable
ospfv3VirtIfTable.reference: OSPF for IPv6, Appendix C.4, Virtual Link Parameters
ospfv3VirtIfTable.description: Information about this router's virtual interfaces that the OSPFv3 Process is configured to carry on.

ospfv3VirtIfEntry.name: ospfv3VirtIfEntry
ospfv3VirtIfEntry.description: Information about a single virtual interface. The information in this table is persistent, and when written, the entity SHOULD save the change to non-volatile storage.

ospfv3VirtIfAreaId.name: ospfv3VirtIfAreaId
ospfv3VirtIfAreaId.description: The transit area that the virtual link traverses. By definition, this is not Area 0.

ospfv3VirtIfNeighbor.name: ospfv3VirtIfNeighbor
ospfv3VirtIfNeighbor.description: The Router ID of the virtual neighbor.

ospfv3VirtIfIndex.name: ospfv3VirtIfIndex
ospfv3VirtIfIndex.description: The local interface index assigned by the OSPFv3 Process to this OSPFv3 virtual interface. It is advertised in Hellos sent over the virtual link and in the router's router-LSAs.

ospfv3VirtIfInstId.name: ospfv3VirtIfInstId
ospfv3VirtIfInstId.description: The local Interface Instance ID assigned by the OSPFv3 Process to this OSPFv3 virtual interface.

ospfv3VirtIfTransitDelay.name: ospfv3VirtIfTransitDelay
ospfv3VirtIfTransitDelay.description: The estimated number of seconds it takes to transmit a Link State Update packet over this interface.

ospfv3VirtIfRetransInterval.name: ospfv3VirtIfRetransInterval
ospfv3VirtIfRetransInterval.description: The number of seconds between link state advertisement retransmissions for adjacencies belonging to this interface. This value is also used when retransmitting database description and Link State Request packets. This value should be well over the expected round-trip time.

ospfv3VirtIfHelloInterval.name: ospfv3VirtIfHelloInterval
ospfv3VirtIfHelloInterval.description: The length of time, in seconds, between the Hello packets that the router sends on the interface. This value must be the same for the virtual neighbor.

ospfv3VirtIfRtrDeadInterval.name: ospfv3VirtIfRtrDeadInterval
ospfv3VirtIfRtrDeadInterval.description: The number of seconds that a router's Hello packets have not been seen before its neighbors declare the router down. This should be some multiple of the Hello interval. This value must be the same for the virtual neighbor.

ospfv3VirtIfState.name: ospfv3VirtIfState
ospfv3VirtIfState.description: OSPF virtual interface states. The same encoding as the ospfV3IfTable is used.

ospfv3VirtIfEvents.name: ospfv3VirtIfEvents
ospfv3VirtIfEvents.description: The number of state changes or error events on this virtual link. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system and at other times as indicated by the value of ospfv3DiscontinuityTime.

ospfv3VirtIfRowStatus.name: ospfv3VirtIfRowStatus
ospfv3VirtIfRowStatus.description: This object permits management of the table by facilitating actions such as row creation, construction, and destruction. The value of this object has no effect on whether other objects in this conceptual row can be modified.

ospfv3VirtIfLinkScopeLsaCount.name: ospfv3VirtIfLinkScopeLsaCount
ospfv3VirtIfLinkScopeLsaCount.description: The total number of Link-scope link state advertisements in this virtual link's link state database.

ospfv3VirtIfLinkLsaCksumSum.name: ospfv3VirtIfLinkLsaCksumSum
ospfv3VirtIfLinkLsaCksumSum.description: The 32-bit unsigned sum of the Link-scope link state advertisements' LS checksums contained in this virtual link's link state database. The sum can be used to determine if there has been a change in a router's link state database or to compare the link state database of two routers.

ospfv3NbrTable.name: ospfv3NbrTable
ospfv3NbrTable.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 10, The Neighbor Data Structure
ospfv3NbrTable.description: A table describing all neighbors in the locality of the OSPFv3 router.

ospfv3NbrEntry.name: ospfv3NbrEntry
ospfv3NbrEntry.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 10, The Neighbor Data Structure
ospfv3NbrEntry.description: The information regarding a single neighbor.

ospfv3NbrIfIndex.name: ospfv3NbrIfIndex
ospfv3NbrIfIndex.description: The Local Link ID of the link over which the neighbor can be reached.

ospfv3NbrIfInstId.name: ospfv3NbrIfInstId
ospfv3NbrIfInstId.description: Interface instance over which the neighbor can be reached. This ID has local link significance only.

ospfv3NbrRtrId.name: ospfv3NbrRtrId
ospfv3NbrRtrId.description: A 32-bit unsigned integer uniquely identifying the neighboring router in the Autonomous System.

ospfv3NbrAddressType.name: ospfv3NbrAddressType
ospfv3NbrAddressType.description: The address type of ospfv3NbrAddress. Only IPv6 addresses without zone index are expected.

ospfv3NbrAddress.name: ospfv3NbrAddress
ospfv3NbrAddress.description: The IPv6 address of the neighbor associated with the local link.

ospfv3NbrOptions.name: ospfv3NbrOptions
ospfv3NbrOptions.reference: OSPF for IPv6, Appendix A.2, The Options Field
ospfv3NbrOptions.description: A bit mask corresponding to the neighbor's options field.

ospfv3NbrPriority.name: ospfv3NbrPriority
ospfv3NbrPriority.description: The priority of this neighbor in the designated- router election algorithm. The value 0 signifies that the neighbor is not eligible to become the Designated Router on this particular network.

ospfv3NbrState.name: ospfv3NbrState
ospfv3NbrState.description: The state of the relationship with this neighbor.

ospfv3NbrEvents.name: ospfv3NbrEvents
ospfv3NbrEvents.description: The number of times this neighbor relationship has changed state or an error has occurred. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system and at other times as indicated by the value of ospfv3DiscontinuityTime.

ospfv3NbrLsRetransQLen.name: ospfv3NbrLsRetransQLen
ospfv3NbrLsRetransQLen.description: The current length of the retransmission queue.

ospfv3NbrHelloSuppressed.name: ospfv3NbrHelloSuppressed
ospfv3NbrHelloSuppressed.description: Indicates whether Hellos are being suppressed to the neighbor.

ospfv3NbrIfId.name: ospfv3NbrIfId
ospfv3NbrIfId.description: The Interface ID that the neighbor advertises in its Hello packets on this link, that is, the neighbor's local interface index.

ospfv3NbrRestartHelperStatus.name: ospfv3NbrRestartHelperStatus
ospfv3NbrRestartHelperStatus.description: Indicates whether the router is acting as a graceful restart helper for the neighbor.

ospfv3NbrRestartHelperAge.name: ospfv3NbrRestartHelperAge
ospfv3NbrRestartHelperAge.description: Remaining time in current OSPF graceful restart interval, if the router is acting as a restart helper for the neighbor.

ospfv3NbrRestartHelperExitReason.name: ospfv3NbrRestartHelperExitReason
ospfv3NbrRestartHelperExitReason.description: Describes the outcome of the last attempt at acting as a graceful restart helper for the neighbor. none: no restart has yet been attempted. inProgress: a restart attempt is currently underway. completed: the last restart completed successfully. timedOut: the last restart timed out. topologyChanged: the last restart was aborted due to a topology change.

ospfv3CfgNbrTable.name: ospfv3CfgNbrTable
ospfv3CfgNbrTable.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 10, The Neighbor Data Structure
ospfv3CfgNbrTable.description: A table describing all configured neighbors. The Configured Neighbors table just gives OSPFv3 information for sending OSPFv3 packets to potential neighbors and is typically used on NBMA and Point-to-Multipoint networks. Once a Hello is received from a neighbor in the Configured Neighbor table, an entry for that neighbor is created in the Neighbor table and adjacency state is maintained there. Neighbors on multi-access or Point-to-Point networks can use multicast addressing, so only Neighbor table entries are created for them.

ospfv3CfgNbrEntry.name: ospfv3CfgNbrEntry
ospfv3CfgNbrEntry.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 10, The Neighbor Data Structure
ospfv3CfgNbrEntry.description: The information regarding a single configured neighbor. The information in this table is persistent, and when written, the entity SHOULD save the change to non-volatile storage.

ospfv3CfgNbrIfIndex.name: ospfv3CfgNbrIfIndex
ospfv3CfgNbrIfIndex.description: The Local Link ID of the link over which the neighbor can be reached.

ospfv3CfgNbrIfInstId.name: ospfv3CfgNbrIfInstId
ospfv3CfgNbrIfInstId.description: Interface instance over which the neighbor can be reached. This ID has local link significance only.

ospfv3CfgNbrAddressType.name: ospfv3CfgNbrAddressType
ospfv3CfgNbrAddressType.description: The address type of ospfv3NbrAddress. Only IPv6 addresses without zone index are expected.

ospfv3CfgNbrAddress.name: ospfv3CfgNbrAddress
ospfv3CfgNbrAddress.description: The IPv6 address of the neighbor associated with the local link.

ospfv3CfgNbrPriority.name: ospfv3CfgNbrPriority
ospfv3CfgNbrPriority.description: The priority of this neighbor in the designated- router election algorithm. The value 0 signifies that the neighbor is not eligible to become the Designated Router on this particular network.

ospfv3CfgNbrRowStatus.name: ospfv3CfgNbrRowStatus
ospfv3CfgNbrRowStatus.description: This object permits management of the table by facilitating actions such as row creation, construction, and destruction. The value of this object has no effect on whether other objects in this conceptual row can be modified.

ospfv3VirtNbrTable.name: ospfv3VirtNbrTable
ospfv3VirtNbrTable.description: A table describing all virtual neighbors.

ospfv3VirtNbrRtrId.name: ospfv3VirtNbrRtrId
ospfv3VirtNbrRtrId.description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the neighboring router in the Autonomous System.

ospfv3VirtNbrIfIndex.name: ospfv3VirtNbrIfIndex
ospfv3VirtNbrIfIndex.description: The local Interface ID for the virtual link over which the neighbor can be reached.

ospfv3VirtNbrIfInstId.name: ospfv3VirtNbrIfInstId
ospfv3VirtNbrIfInstId.description: The interface instance for the virtual link over which the neighbor can be reached.

ospfv3VirtNbrAddressType.name: ospfv3VirtNbrAddressType
ospfv3VirtNbrAddressType.description: The address type of ospfv3VirtNbrAddress. Only IPv6 addresses without zone index are expected.

ospfv3VirtNbrAddress.name: ospfv3VirtNbrAddress
ospfv3VirtNbrAddress.description: The IPv6 address advertised by this virtual neighbor. It must be a global scope address.

ospfv3VirtNbrOptions.name: ospfv3VirtNbrOptions
ospfv3VirtNbrOptions.reference: OSPF for IPv6, Appendix A.2, The Options Field
ospfv3VirtNbrOptions.description: A bit mask corresponding to the neighbor's options field.

ospfv3VirtNbrState.name: ospfv3VirtNbrState
ospfv3VirtNbrState.description: The state of the virtual neighbor relationship.

ospfv3VirtNbrEvents.name: ospfv3VirtNbrEvents
ospfv3VirtNbrEvents.description: The number of times this virtual link has changed its state or an error has occurred. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system and at other times as indicated by the value of ospfv3DiscontinuityTime.

ospfv3VirtNbrLsRetransQLen.name: ospfv3VirtNbrLsRetransQLen
ospfv3VirtNbrLsRetransQLen.description: The current length of the retransmission queue.

ospfv3VirtNbrHelloSuppressed.name: ospfv3VirtNbrHelloSuppressed
ospfv3VirtNbrHelloSuppressed.description: Indicates whether Hellos are being suppressed to the neighbor.

ospfv3VirtNbrIfId.name: ospfv3VirtNbrIfId
ospfv3VirtNbrIfId.description: The Interface ID that the neighbor advertises in its Hello packets on this virtual link, that is, the neighbor's local Interface ID.

ospfv3VirtNbrRestartHelperStatus.name: ospfv3VirtNbrRestartHelperStatus
ospfv3VirtNbrRestartHelperStatus.description: Indicates whether the router is acting as a graceful restart helper for the neighbor.

ospfv3VirtNbrRestartHelperAge.name: ospfv3VirtNbrRestartHelperAge
ospfv3VirtNbrRestartHelperAge.description: Remaining time in the current OSPF graceful restart interval, if the router is acting as a restart helper for the neighbor.

ospfv3VirtNbrRestartHelperExitReason.name: ospfv3VirtNbrRestartHelperExitReason
ospfv3VirtNbrRestartHelperExitReason.description: Describes the outcome of the last attempt at acting as a graceful restart helper for the neighbor. none: no restart has yet been attempted. inProgress: a restart attempt is currently underway. completed: the last restart completed successfully. timedOut: the last restart timed out. topologyChanged: the last restart was aborted due to a topology change.

ospfv3AreaAggregateTable.name: ospfv3AreaAggregateTable
ospfv3AreaAggregateTable.description: The Area Aggregate Table acts as an adjunct to the Area Table. It describes those address aggregates that are configured to be propagated from an area. Its purpose is to reduce the amount of information that is known beyond an area's borders. A range of IPv6 prefixes specified by a prefix / prefix length pair. Note that if ranges are configured such that one range subsumes another range, the most specific match is the preferred one.

ospfv3AreaAggregateEntry.name: ospfv3AreaAggregateEntry
ospfv3AreaAggregateEntry.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.2, Area parameters
ospfv3AreaAggregateEntry.description: A single area aggregate entry. Information in this table is persistent, and when this object is written, the entity SHOULD save the change to non-volatile storage.

ospfv3AreaAggregateAreaID.name: ospfv3AreaAggregateAreaID
ospfv3AreaAggregateAreaID.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.2, Area parameters
ospfv3AreaAggregateAreaID.description: The area the Address Aggregate is to be found within.

ospfv3AreaAggregateAreaLsdbType.name: ospfv3AreaAggregateAreaLsdbType
ospfv3AreaAggregateAreaLsdbType.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix A.4.1, The LSA header
ospfv3AreaAggregateAreaLsdbType.description: The type of the Address Aggregate. This field specifies the Area LSDB type that this Address Aggregate applies to.

ospfv3AreaAggregatePrefixType.name: ospfv3AreaAggregatePrefixType
ospfv3AreaAggregatePrefixType.description: The prefix type of ospfv3AreaAggregatePrefix. Only IPv6 addresses are expected.

ospfv3AreaAggregatePrefix.name: ospfv3AreaAggregatePrefix
ospfv3AreaAggregatePrefix.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.2, Area parameters

ospfv3AreaAggregatePrefixLength.name: ospfv3AreaAggregatePrefixLength
ospfv3AreaAggregatePrefixLength.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.2, Area parameters
ospfv3AreaAggregatePrefixLength.description: The length of the prefix (in bits). A prefix can not be shorter than 3 bits.

ospfv3AreaAggregateRowStatus.name: ospfv3AreaAggregateRowStatus
ospfv3AreaAggregateRowStatus.description: This object permits management of the table by facilitating actions such as row creation, construction, and destruction. The value of this object has no effect on whether other objects in this conceptual row can be modified.

ospfv3AreaAggregateEffect.name: ospfv3AreaAggregateEffect
ospfv3AreaAggregateEffect.description: Prefixes subsumed by ranges will either trigger the advertisement of the indicated aggregate (advertiseMatching) or result in the prefix not being advertised at all outside the area.

ospfv3AreaAggregateRouteTag.name: ospfv3AreaAggregateRouteTag
ospfv3AreaAggregateRouteTag.description: This tag is advertised only in the summarized As-External LSA when summarizing from NSSA-LSAs to AS-External-LSAs.

ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbTable.name: ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbTable
ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbTable.description: The OSPFv3 Process's Link-scope LSDB for virtual interfaces. The LSDB contains the Link-scope link state advertisements from virtual interfaces.

ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbEntry.name: ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbEntry
ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbEntry.description: A single Link-scope link state advertisement for a virtual interface.

ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbIfAreaId.name: ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbIfAreaId
ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbIfAreaId.description: The transit area that the virtual link traverses. By definition, this is not Area 0.

ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbIfNeighbor.name: ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbIfNeighbor
ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbIfNeighbor.description: The Router ID of the virtual neighbor.

ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbType.name: ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbType
ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbType.description: The type of the link state advertisement. Each link state type has a separate advertisement format. Link-scope LSAs unrecognized by the router are also stored in this database.

ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbRouterId.name: ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbRouterId
ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbRouterId.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.1, Global parameters
ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbRouterId.description: The 32-bit number that uniquely identifies the originating router in the Autonomous System.

ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbLsid.name: ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbLsid
ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbLsid.description: The Link State ID is an LS type-specific field containing a unique identifier; it identifies the piece of the routing domain that is being described by the advertisement. In contrast to OSPFv2, the LSID has no addressing semantics.

ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbSequence.name: ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbSequence
ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbSequence.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 12.1.6, LS sequence number
ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbSequence.description: The sequence number field is a signed 32-bit integer. It is used to detect old and duplicate link state advertisements. The space of sequence numbers is linearly ordered. The larger the sequence number, the more recent the advertisement.

ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbAge.name: ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbAge
ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbAge.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 12.1.1, LS age; Extending OSPF to Support Demand Circuits, Section 2.2, The LS age field.
ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbAge.description: This field is the age of the link state advertisement in seconds. The high-order bit of the LS age field is considered the DoNotAge bit for support of on-demand circuits.

ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbChecksum.name: ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbChecksum
ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbChecksum.description: This field is the checksum of the complete contents of the advertisement, excepting the age field. The age field is excepted so that an advertisement's age can be incremented without updating the checksum. The checksum used is the same that is used for ISO connectionless datagrams; it is commonly referred to as the Fletcher checksum.

ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbAdvertisement.name: ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbAdvertisement
ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbAdvertisement.description: The entire link state advertisement, including its header.

ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbTypeKnown.name: ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbTypeKnown
ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbTypeKnown.description: The value true (1) indicates that the LSA type is recognized by this router.

ospfv3ConfigErrorType.name: ospfv3ConfigErrorType
ospfv3ConfigErrorType.description: Potential types of configuration conflicts. Used by the ospfv3ConfigError and ospfv3ConfigVirtError notifications.

ospfv3PacketSrc.name: ospfv3PacketSrc
ospfv3PacketSrc.description: The IPv6 address of an inbound packet that cannot be identified by a neighbor instance. Only IPv6 addresses without zone index are expected.

ospfv3VirtIfStateChange.name: ospfv3VirtIfStateChange
ospfv3VirtIfStateChange.description: An ospfv3VirtIfStateChange notification signifies that there has been a change in the state of an OSPFv3 virtual interface. This notification should be generated when the interface state regresses (e.g., goes from Point-to-Point to Down) or progresses to a terminal state (i.e., Point-to-Point).

ospfv3NbrStateChange.name: ospfv3NbrStateChange
ospfv3NbrStateChange.description: An ospfv3NbrStateChange notification signifies that there has been a change in the state of a non-virtual OSPFv3 neighbor. This notification should be generated when the neighbor state regresses (e.g., goes from Attempt or Full to 1-Way or Down) or progresses to a terminal state (e.g., 2-Way or Full). When a neighbor transitions from or to Full on non-broadcast multi-access and broadcast networks, the notification should be generated by the Designated Router. A Designated Router transitioning to Down will be noted by ospfIfStateChange.

ospfv3VirtNbrStateChange.name: ospfv3VirtNbrStateChange
ospfv3VirtNbrStateChange.description: An ospfv3VirtNbrStateChange notification signifies that there has been a change in the state of an OSPFv3 virtual neighbor. This notification should be generated when the neighbor state regresses (e.g., goes from Attempt or Full to 1-Way or Down) or progresses to a terminal state (e.g., Full).

ospfv3IfConfigError.name: ospfv3IfConfigError
ospfv3IfConfigError.description: An ospfv3IfConfigError notification signifies that a packet has been received on a non-virtual interface from a router whose configuration parameters conflict with this router's configuration parameters. Note that the event optionMismatch should cause a notification only if it prevents an adjacency from forming.

ospfv3VirtIfConfigError.name: ospfv3VirtIfConfigError
ospfv3VirtIfConfigError.description: An ospfv3VirtIfConfigError notification signifies that a packet has been received on a virtual interface from a router whose configuration parameters conflict with this router's configuration parameters. Note that the event optionMismatch should cause a notification only if it prevents an adjacency from forming.

ospfv3IfRxBadPacket.name: ospfv3IfRxBadPacket
ospfv3IfRxBadPacket.description: An ospfv3IfRxBadPacket notification signifies that an OSPFv3 packet that cannot be parsed has been received on a non-virtual interface.

ospfv3VirtIfRxBadPacket.name: ospfv3VirtIfRxBadPacket
ospfv3VirtIfRxBadPacket.description: An ospfv3VirtIfRxBadPacket notification signifies that an OSPFv3 packet that cannot be parsed has been received on a virtual interface.

ospfv3LsdbOverflow.name: ospfv3LsdbOverflow
ospfv3LsdbOverflow.description: An ospfv3LsdbOverflow notification signifies that the number of LSAs in the router's link state database has exceeded ospfv3ExtAreaLsdbLimit.

ospfv3LsdbApproachingOverflow.name: ospfv3LsdbApproachingOverflow
ospfv3LsdbApproachingOverflow.description: An ospfv3LsdbApproachingOverflow notification signifies that the number of LSAs in the router's link state database has exceeded ninety percent of ospfv3ExtAreaLsdbLimit.

ospfv3IfStateChange.name: ospfv3IfStateChange
ospfv3IfStateChange.description: An ospfv3IfStateChange notification signifies that there has been a change in the state of a non-virtual OSPFv3 interface. This notification should be generated when the interface state regresses (e.g., goes from DR to Down) or progresses to a terminal state (i.e., Point-to-Point, DR Other, DR, or Backup).

ospfv3NssaTranslatorStatusChange.name: ospfv3NssaTranslatorStatusChange
ospfv3NssaTranslatorStatusChange.description: An ospfv3NssaTranslatorStatusChange notification indicates that there has been a change in the router's ability to translate OSPFv3 NSSA LSAs into OSPFv3 External LSAs. This notification should be generated when the Translator Status transitions from or to any defined status on a per-area basis.

ospfv3RestartStatusChange.name: ospfv3RestartStatusChange
ospfv3RestartStatusChange.description: An ospfv3RestartStatusChange notification signifies that there has been a change in the graceful restart state for the router. This notification should be generated when the router restart status changes.

ospfv3NbrRestartHelperStatusChange.name: ospfv3NbrRestartHelperStatusChange
ospfv3NbrRestartHelperStatusChange.description: An ospfv3NbrRestartHelperStatusChange notification signifies that there has been a change in the graceful restart helper state for the neighbor. This notification should be generated when the neighbor restart helper status transitions for a neighbor.

ospfv3VirtNbrRestartHelperStatusChange.name: ospfv3VirtNbrRestartHelperStatusChange
ospfv3VirtNbrRestartHelperStatusChange.description: An ospfv3VirtNbrRestartHelperStatusChange notification signifies that there has been a change in the graceful restart helper state for the virtual neighbor. This notification should be generated when the virtual neighbor restart helper status transitions for a virtual neighbor.

ospfv3ReadOnlyCompliance.name: ospfv3ReadOnlyCompliance
ospfv3ReadOnlyCompliance.description: When this MIB module is implemented without support for read-create (i.e., in read-only mode), the implementation can claim read-only compliance. Such a device can then be monitored, but cannot be configured with this MIB.

ospfv3BasicGroup.name: ospfv3BasicGroup
ospfv3BasicGroup.description: These objects are used for managing/monitoring OSPFv3 global parameters.

ospfv3AreaGroup.name: ospfv3AreaGroup
ospfv3AreaGroup.description: These objects are used for OSPFv3 systems supporting areas.

ospfv3AsLsdbGroup.name: ospfv3AsLsdbGroup
ospfv3AsLsdbGroup.description: These objects are used for OSPFv3 systems that display their AS-scope link state database.

ospfv3AreaLsdbGroup.name: ospfv3AreaLsdbGroup
ospfv3AreaLsdbGroup.description: These objects are used for OSPFv3 systems that display their Area-scope link state database.

ospfv3LinkLsdbGroup.name: ospfv3LinkLsdbGroup
ospfv3LinkLsdbGroup.description: These objects are used for OSPFv3 systems that display their Link-scope link state database for non-virtual interfaces.

ospfv3HostGroup.name: ospfv3HostGroup
ospfv3HostGroup.description: These objects are used for OSPFv3 systems that support attached hosts.

ospfv3IfGroup.name: ospfv3IfGroup
ospfv3IfGroup.description: These interface objects are used for managing/monitoring OSPFv3 interfaces.

ospfv3VirtIfGroup.name: ospfv3VirtIfGroup
ospfv3VirtIfGroup.description: These virtual interface objects are used for managing/monitoring OSPFv3 virtual interfaces.

ospfv3NbrGroup.name: ospfv3NbrGroup
ospfv3NbrGroup.description: These neighbor objects are used for managing/monitoring OSPFv3 neighbors.

ospfv3CfgNbrGroup.name: ospfv3CfgNbrGroup
ospfv3CfgNbrGroup.description: These configured neighbor objects are used for managing/monitoring OSPFv3-configured neighbors.

ospfv3VirtNbrGroup.name: ospfv3VirtNbrGroup
ospfv3VirtNbrGroup.description: These virtual neighbor objects are used for managing/monitoring OSPFv3 virtual neighbors.

ospfv3AreaAggregateGroup.name: ospfv3AreaAggregateGroup
ospfv3AreaAggregateGroup.description: These area aggregate objects are required for aggregating OSPFv3 prefixes for summarization across areas.

ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbGroup.name: ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbGroup
ospfv3VirtLinkLsdbGroup.description: These objects are used for OSPFv3 systems that display their Link-scope link state database for virtual interfaces.

ospfv3NotificationObjectGroup.name: ospfv3NotificationObjectGroup
ospfv3NotificationObjectGroup.description: These objects are used to record notification parameters.

ospfv3NotificationGroup.name: ospfv3NotificationGroup
ospfv3NotificationGroup.description: This group is used for OSPFv3 notifications.
